intro: Diphyes cernua, commonly known as the nodding bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, nodding flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are slender and branched. The flowers bloom in summer and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to the plant's ecological role in its habitat.
